Class Invoker

java.lang.Object
com.utils.Invoker
public class Invoker extends Object
Invoker class that acts as a central hub for executing commands. This class holds references to all command implementations and provides methods to invoke them based on user input. It follows the Command pattern to decouple command invocation from command execution logic.

  • Method Details

    • RemoveById

      public void RemoveById(Long id)
      Removes a music band from the collection by its unique ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the music band to remove

    • RemoveByBestAlbum

      public void RemoveByBestAlbum(String albumName)
      Removes a music band from the collection by its best album name. Only removes one element (the first match found).
      Parameters:
      albumName - the name of the best album to search for

    • RemoveGreaterThanId

      public void RemoveGreaterThanId(Long id)
      Removes all music bands from the collection that have an ID greater than the specified value.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID threshold - all bands with ID greater than this will be removed

    • UpdateElement

      public void UpdateElement()
      Updates an element in the collection by prompting the user for new values. This method prompts for the ID and then all fields.

    • ListAll

      public void ListAll()
      Lists all elements in the collection, displaying their string representation.

    • Exit

      public void Exit()
      Exits the application without saving.

    • Clear

      public void Clear()
      Clears all elements from the collection.

    • ListInfo

      public void ListInfo()
      Displays information about the collection including type, initialization date, and element count.

    • AddElement

      public void AddElement()
      Adds a new element to the collection by prompting the user for all field values.

    • AddIfMin

      public void AddIfMin()
      Adds a new element to the collection only if its ID is less than the minimum ID in the collection. Prompts the user for all field values.

    • AverageParticipants

      public void AverageParticipants()
      Calculates and displays the average value of the numberOfParticipants field across all elements in the collection.

    • ParticipantsById

      public void ParticipantsById(Long id)
      Displays the number of participants for a specific music band by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the music band

    • PrintHistory

      public void PrintHistory()
      Displays the history of the last 11 commands executed.

    • PrintHelp

      public void PrintHelp()
      Displays help information about all available commands.

    • ExecuteScript

      public void ExecuteScript(String filePath)
      Executes a script file containing commands to be processed.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the script file to execute

    • UpdateElementWithId

      public void UpdateElementWithId(Long id)
      Updates a specific element in the collection by its ID with new values.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the music band to update

    • Save

      public void Save()
      Saves the collection to the default file path.

    • Load

      public void Load()
      Loads the collection from the default file path.

      public void Load(String filePath)
      Loads the collection from a specified file path.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the file to load from

    • CountByParticipants

      public void CountByParticipants(Integer count)
      Counts and displays the number of elements in the collection that have the specified number of participants.
      Parameters:
      count - the number of participants to search for
